alert.note: Alert for Fergus (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 2:46PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Fergus County through 315 PM MDT... At 245 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Winifred to 9 miles southeast of Grass Range. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Roy, Fergus and Fred Robinson Bridge. This includes the following highways... Highway 200 between mile markers 114 and 123. Highway 191 between mile markers 30 and 42, and between mile markers 47 and 87. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. In addition, frequent cloud to ground lightning is also occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for central Montana.
